parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly. From pro and lego; to say beforehand, i.e. Predict, forewarn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be absent. From apo and eimi; to be away.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly. From pro and lego; to say beforehand, i.e. Predict, forewarn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To sin previously. From pro and hamartano; to sin previously.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Left, left behind, the remainder, the rest, the others. Masculine plural of a derivative of leipo; remaining ones.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular

str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To spare, abstain, forbear. Of uncertain affinity; to be chary of, i.e. to abstain or to treat leniently.
